figure.class: sqs-block-image-figure image-block-outer-wrapper image-block-v2 design-layout-collage combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none image-position-left

img.alt: Coronavirus(COVID-19) - Information and Updates SurroundingCleveland County Schools

div.p:
Coronavirus
(COVID-19)

Information and Updates Surrounding
Cleveland County Schools
The Governor of North Carolina extended the Executive Order that all schools throughout the state will be closed for students until at least May 15.

COVID-19 has created lots of uncertainty over the past ten days. Cleveland County Schools remains committed to providing the best service possible to our students, staff and community during the coming days, weeks and months. This past week, we have opened 22 child feeding stations and designed 8 Wi-Fi hotspots in our community. While we have been able to provide some answers and solutions, many questions and concerns still exist. Our goal is to provide updated and accurate information to you as soon as possible.

The common message used by many of our media outlets is "We are in this together.” Cleveland County Schools is committed to our students, schools and community, and together we will overcome these challenges and continue to make Cleveland County a great place to live, work, learn and play.
El Gobernador de Carolina del Norte extendió la Orden Ejecutiva de que todas las escuelas en todo el estado permanecerán cerradas para los estudiantes hasta al menos el 15 de mayo.

COVID-19 ha creado mucha incertidumbre en los últimos 10 días. Las Escuelas del Condado de Cleveland siguen comprometidas a brindar el mejor servicio posible a nuestros estudiantes, personal y comunidad durante los próximos días, semanas y meses. La semana pasada, abrimos 22 estaciones de alimentación infantil y diseñamos 8 puntos de acceso Wi-Fi en nuestra comunidad. Si bien hemos podido proporcionar algunas respuestas y soluciones, todavía existen muchas preguntas y preocupaciones. Nuestro objetivo es proporcionarle información actualizada y precisa lo antes posible.

El mensaje común utilizado por muchos de nuestros medios de comunicación es "Estamos juntos en esto". Las Escuelas del Condado de Cleveland están comprometidas con nuestros estudiantes, escuelas y comunidad y juntos superaremos estos desafíos y continuaremos haciendo del Condado de Cleveland un excelente lugar para vivir, trabajar, aprender y jugar.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

h3.strong: STUDENT PRACTICE MATERIALS FOR TEMPORARY AT-HOME LEARNING

div.p: School Nutrition Services will provide free meals beginning Monday, March 16th - Mondays through Fridays from 11:30 am to 1 pm at all school sites except Burns High, Crest High, Kings Mountain High, Shelby Middle, North Shelby, and East Elementary as each of those locations are near other meal sites.
During the daily pickup opportunity (between 11:30 am to 1 pm at the front of each school unless directed otherwise), lunch will be provided as well as a breakfast for the following morning.

The meals are available to any child or teen ages 2 to 18 years old at any meal site of their choosing. We especially encourage all of our students to participate in this program while school is out during this time.
For additional details regarding the meal program, please visit the CCS School Nutrition Services website at www.clevelandcountynutrition.org.

Los servicios de nutrición escolar proveerán comidas de manera gratuita de lunes a viernes de 11:30 a.m. a 1:00 p.m., a partir del lunes, 16 de marzo, en todas las escuelas a excepción de Burns High, Crest High, Kings Mountain High, Shelby Middle, North Shelby y la escuela primaria de East, ya que estas escuelas se encuentran cercanas a otras escuelas que tendrán el plan alimenticio.
Durante la entrega de comidas diaria (entre 11:30 a.m. y 1:00 p.m. al frente de cada escuela, a menos que se indique lo contrario), se proveerá el almuerzo y desayuno para el día siguiente.

Las comidas estarán disponibles para todos los niños entre 2 y 18 años en cualquier lugar de su escogencia. Queremos alentar especialmente a todos nuestros estudiantes a que participen en este programa mientras la escuela esté suspendida.
Para mayor información con relación al programa alimenticio, por favor visite los servicios nutricionales de las escuelas de CCS en la página web www.clevelandcountynutrition.org.

div.a: Crest High Kahoot Interactive Zoom Session

div.p: Lisa Houser, the Vocational Education teacher at Crest High, provided a familiar means of vocabulary instruction for her Sports Marketing students.

a.data-title: Shelby Middle Students Send Videos and Pictures Supporting Educators

img.alt: Shelby Middle Students Send Videos and Pictures Supporting Educators

div.a: Shelby Middle Students Send Videos and Pictures Supporting Educators

div.p: Students from Shelby Middle have sent several videos and pictures in an effort to remind the school staff members that they are loved and missed during this time.

a.data-title: KMMS Science Teacher 3D Printing Masks for Local Healthcare Workers

img.alt: KMMS Science Teacher 3D Printing Masks for Local Healthcare Workers

div.a: KMMS Science Teacher 3D Printing Masks for Local Healthcare Workers

div.p: Beverly Owens, an eighth-grade science teacher at Kings Mountain Middle School, has been 3D printing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for local healthcare workers, facilities, and the hospital. Mrs. Owens has printed and distributed over 400 pieces of PPE gear to individuals in Shelby, Kings Mountain, and Gastonia.

a.data-title: Keep Kids Learning Project - Partners in Education

img.alt: Keep Kids Learning Project - Partners in Education

div.a: Keep Kids Learning Project - Partners in Education

div.p: Miss Travis and Miss Taylor both received a $1000 grant from Donors Choose (as a part of a selected small group of teachers through a pilot program) that would allow them to purchase items their students need to be successful during this virtual learning time.

div.class:
summary-item summary-item-record-type-text sqs-gallery-design-list-slide
summary-item-has-thumbnail summary-item-has-excerpt
summary-item-has-author

div.p: Seniors from Crest High School have recorded shout-outs to the school faculty member who impacted them most during their educational tenure at Crest High.

summary-item-has-author

a.data-title: Casar PE Teacher Continuing to Teach During School Shutdown

img.alt: Casar PE Teacher Continuing to Teach During School Shutdown

div.a: Casar PE Teacher Continuing to Teach During School Shutdown

div.p: Since schools have been closed, Casar PE Teacher Leigh Ann Earwood has continued to teach. Each school day, Earwood shares a video on Casar School's Facebook Page. Recently, Ms. Earwood highlighted some of her horses, which she often discusses in her PE classes at school. Our students loved learning about Ms. Earwood's horses. These videos were featured in an article in The Shelby Star.

a.data-title: Cindy Estridge's Lesson on Calculating Molar Mass Highlighted on WUNC.org

img.alt: Cindy Estridge's Lesson on Calculating Molar Mass Highlighted on WUNC.org

div.a: Cindy Estridge's Lesson on Calculating Molar Mass Highlighted on WUNC.org

div.p: Cindy Estridge, a chemistry teacher at Kings Mountain, shared a lesson online about calculating molar mass. North Carolina Public Radio 91.5 (WUNC) interviewed Estridge about the lesson and the many other lessons she has shared online.

a.data-title: Dr. Nellie Aspel Remarks Featured in EdNC Article

img.alt: Dr. Nellie Aspel Remarks Featured in EdNC Article

div.a: Dr. Nellie Aspel Remarks Featured in EdNC Article

div.p: A recently published EducationNC (EdNC) article, “Everyone will be learning differently for a while — but what about students with learning differences?” article features comments from Dr. Nellie Aspel, the Director of Exceptional Children for Cleveland County Schools.

a.data-title: Graham Student Creating a House Box Sculpture

img.alt: Graham Student Creating a House Box Sculpture

div.a: Graham Student Creating a House Box Sculpture

div.p: Carmello Webber, a student at Graham Elementary, was inspired by his teacher to create a House box Sculpture while at home. Here is some of his early work.

h2.strong: In an effort to provide educational connectivity, the Cleveland County Schools Technology Services Team has provided public wireless access (WiFi) via outdoor hotspots at Bethware Elementary, Boiling Springs Elementary, Burns Middle, Casar Elementary, Central Services/Turning Point Academy, Crest Middle, East Elementary, Fallston Elementary, Graham Elementary, Grover Elementary, James Love Elementary, Jefferson Elementary, Kings Mountain High, Shelby High, Springmore Elementary, Township Three Elementary, Union Elementary, and Washington Elementary. Any device should be able to connect to the guest CCS-BYOD network without the need for an access password.

As shown below, each free WiFi location has a designated parking area in which users can experience the best signal. Please remain in your vehicles during use. This service is available seven days a week between the hours of 7 a.m. and 10 p.m.

strong.em: (Click each image to enlarge for better viewing)

div.h3: ENCUESTA SOBRE ACCESO AL INTERNET DE ALTA VELOCIDAD EN LOS HOGARES

div.p: In the event students remain out of school for multiple weeks, we would like to know who has access to high-speed internet at home. This information is vital in helping us manage our remote learning strategy. Parents or students, please click here to take the survey.

En caso que los estudiantes no puedan regresar a la escuela por múltiples semanas, nos gustaría saber quiénes tienen acceso a internet de alta velocidad en su casa. Esta información es vital en ayudarnos a manejar la estrategia del aprendizaje remoto. Padres o estudiantes, por favor haga click aquí para responder a la encuesta.

h3.strong: ÁREAS DE ACCESO INALÁMBRICOS WIFI GRATUITOS DE SPECTRUM

div.p: Click here to enter your address finding the nearest FREE Spectrum Wifi Hotspots in your area.
Haga clic aquí para colocar su dirección y así poder conseguir el punto de acceso inalámbrico (wifi) GRATUITO que se encuentra en su área.

li.p: Avoid contact with people who are sick
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissues in the trash
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe

Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing - both hot and cold water work the same
If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based sanitizer with at least sixty percent (60%) alcohol
Always wash your hands with soap and water
When applicable, practice social distancing
Social distancing measures include limiting large groups of people coming together, keeping a distance from others of six feet and not shaking hands
Evite el contacto con las persona que se encuentren enfermas.
Evite tocarse los ojos, nariz y boca.
Tape su tos o estornudo con pañuelos desechables y luego bótelos en la basura.
Limpie y desinfecte los objetos y superficies que se toquen con frecuencia utilizando un aerosol o pañitos húmedos de limpieza para el hogar .

Lávese las manos con frecuencia utilizando jabón y agua por lo menos por 20 segundos, especialmente después de utilizar el baño, antes de comer y después de sonarse la nariz, toser o estornudar. Usar agua fría o caliente tiene el mismo resultado.
Si no tiene acceso a agua y jabón, utilice un desinfectante con base de alcohol de al menos sesenta porciento (60%) de alcohol.
Siempre debe lavarse las manos con agua y jabón.
Cuando corresponda, mantenga la distancia socia.l
Las medidas de distancia social incluyen limitar el contacto con grandes grupos de personas que se reúnan, mantener la distancia de 6 pies y no darse la mano.

p.a: Talking to Kids about the Coronavirus
